page.title: 11Pendomer
page.content: Pendomer is a hamlet of only about 8 dwellings and the church. Except for one new bungalow, and some new farm buildings, all the houses are old and there seems little likelihood of any more development. The one road leading to the village is narrow and winding, and goes nowhere else; the land is all intensively farmed. The former Manor House, though altered and reduced in size, is still a handsome building. The Old School House, which once accommodated both the school and the teacher, has been a dwelling for some years. The children of Pendomer are now taken by bus to primary school in East Coker, or secondary school in Yeovil. Nevertheless this is a lively and pleasant place to live in, with a travelling library, a WI shared with Hardington Mandeville & the facilities of Yeovil only about 5 miles away.
